content: quote: Originally posted by L0A1: quote: Originally posted by Fightdirector: Doesn't make you anything, everyone is allowed their views, I mean President Obama hasn't outlawed that yet has he? As an American who is a follower of Jesus Christ (which means I am considered to be "of the Left"), the OP's "Left's 'View of America'" doesn't make any sense - except maybe to him. Former Vice President Cheney acted, during his 8 years as de facto President, as if I or other American like me were not allowed to disagree with him or publicaly hold any views different than his. That was just one of the many reasons I voted for the present President, Barack Obama, rather than John McCain. President Obama clearly seems to have more respect for the 1st Amendment's Freedom of Speech doctrine than the Cheney wing of the Republican Party.
quote: Originally posted by L0A1: quote: Originally posted by Fightdirector: Doesn't make you anything, everyone is allowed their views, I mean President Obama hasn't outlawed that yet has he?

content: quote: Originally posted by scottrj50: is it segragated?... Yes, it is. There are those that actually defend their country and demographic, and then there are those that do nothing but still feel inclined to tout their worth on an Internet message board in an out-of-context manner. The only thing segregating anyone is perception. It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.
